title: OpenAI partners with US National Laboratories on research and nuclear weapon safety
content: If you click 'Accept all', we and our partners, including 239 who are part of the IAB Transparency & Consent Framework, will also store and/or access information on a device (in other words, use … [+703 chars]
summary: OpenAI, the artificial intelligence research company, has announced a partnership with three US National Laboratories: Lawrence Livermore, Los Alamos, and Sandia. The collaboration aims to conduct research on advanced AI systems and explore ways to enhance the safety and security of nuclear weapons using AI technologies. The partnership will focus on developing AI tools and techniques to support the laboratories' missions while prioritizing the responsible development and deployment of AI. However, specific details about the research projects and their potential applications have not been disclosed.

Title: Clever architecture over raw compute: DeepSeek shatters the 'bigger is better' approach to AI development

Summary:
DeepSeek, a startup founded by former Google Brain researcher David Krueger, has developed an AI model that challenges the prevailing notion that larger models with more computing power are always better. Their model, DeepSeek-Chat, outperforms OpenAI's GPT-4 on certain benchmarks despite being 1,000 times smaller and trained on significantly less data.

Key points:
1. DeepSeek's approach focuses on architectural innovations rather than simply increasing model size and computing power.

Initially reported to have affected around 100 million individuals
, the U.S. heal… [+7258 chars]
summary:
Title: UnitedHealth cyberattack exposes 190 million in largest US healthcare data breach

Summary:
UnitedHealth's Change Healthcare unit experienced a data breach in February 2024, which was reported on February 21. The breach was initially thought to have affected around 100 million individuals, but further investigation revealed that approximately 190 million individuals were impacted, making it the largest healthcare data breach in U.S. history. The compromised information included names, addresses, dates of birth, Social Security numbers, and health insurance information. UnitedHealth stated that no medical records or financial information were exposed. The company is working with law enforcement and cybersecurity experts to investigate the incident an
